website_summaries.verdict: A no-frills adjustable workout bench that offers about what you'd expect from an item in this price range.
pros: This basic bench offers 5 different positions ranging from a very slight decline to a 70° incline
Seat positioning is quick and easy
The bench is rated up to 300 lb., and the frame comes with a 3 yr. warranty
cons: The bench is a little narrow, and the foldable legs can be troublesome when attempting to store

customer_reviews.title: Very serviceable for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in a small condo. It is fairly priced and well made. The bench is easy to collapse and store and is extremely functional for a number of exercises. The stability is good but not great for exercises with your chest on the bench (rear delt work, spider curls). I would think twice before adding the preacher/leg curl attachment. It is cumbersome to store and the leg exercises do not allow great range of motion. This bench may not be suitable for taller or wider folks due to its size.
customer_reviews.author: From Boston

customer_reviews.title: Been a decent bench for me
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a pretty decent bench. Please note - it does not lay out exactly flat. Not a big deal to me and still fully functional - I actually took it apart twice to see if I put something together wrong. Overall still worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Don Mac

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product description.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how to rate this. The bench itself is solid for its size, well packaged, and easy to put together. However, it does not offer a decline position as stated repeatedly in the product description. I really wanted a bench with decline, flat AND incline positions. The only way I can see to get a decline position is set the front leg to its highest position and back leg to lowest position, obviously a huge inconvenience while in the middle of a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very good bench
customer_reviews.text: Very, very heavy and sturdy. Adjustment is a breeze. Includes spring-loaded pins and bolts for adjustment allowing you to permanently fix the legs if you want. Very little assembly, and what there was had great instructions. For the price, I don't think there is a better, more versatile bench. However, it is almost impossible to get it to lie completely flat. All positions are either inclined slightly or declined slightly. The product picture is a good example. Set up like this, if you lay the back down flat, it is slightly declined. If you put the support on the first notch, it is slightly inclined. I have yet to be able to get it completely flat.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: People complain it's narrow for your back and it is. This is why I love it.. I get a full range motion and it really shows when your chest is much more rounded. While on a thicker width bench you don't get this result of full muscle workout.. However, if you're a really tall or big guy it may not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bench! It folds to store in a small ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bench! It folds to store in a small place. I'm 6ft and when the bench is inclined, my head doesn't rest on the back, but this isn't an issue for me. The bench is very sturdy. There is some play when the leg extension attachment is being used...this is not an issue either. It is narrow and this allows better range of motion when doing bench presses. I like the ability to add the leg extension/curl. You cannot beat this bench! For $200 you get the bench and leg attachment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopr

customer_reviews.title: Not quite big enough for me, but still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy enough. It is, however, a bit narrow. Still gets the job done, especially for everybody else since they are all smaller than me. I am almost 300 pounds. I would still recommend it. Works as described.
customer_reviews.author: S. Aschoff

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bench regardless of the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bench regardless of the price!!! Easy to setup and use, the legs even fold under if you use the included pull pin setup. This is great for storing away under a bed perhaps. It was well packaged and shipped in a timely manner. Unless you are very particular about your gym equipment you will not be disappointed in this product. thanks Best Fitness for making an affordable bench!!
customer_reviews.author: James Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive basic quality workbench
customer_reviews.text: The most attractive part of this bench probably is the price. I have been using it for two years now. I strongly recommend it. Here are the pros and cons. Pros: 1. Inexpensive 2. Good looking and durable. It doesn't feel cheap. 3. Can be easily stowed away. It comes with removable pins. You can easily flatten the bench and put it away. Cons: 1. Back is short: I am not tall. The length of the back fits me pretty well. If you are tall, this unit may be too small for you. 2. No heels support. But we are talking about a bench around one hundred bucks. I really cannot ask too much.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Chen

customer_reviews.title: This Bench is AWESOME!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Better than advertised. Comes completely assembled except for pins to extend the legs out. Sturdy as can be and just the right length and width for Large People. I'm 6'2" and have no problem with it. I doesn't rock or move at all while you are lifting, and the added 4 position back rest is just right. Have had 2 days and just did a complete Shoulder workout with no problems. Amazon was awesome, this bech sells for $195 from Best Fitness but Amazon has it for $110 and with free shipping I received it in 2 days. If you need a great bench then get this one!!!
customer_reviews.author: tfairfield

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use with dumbbells. I find it sturdy and stable. Adjusting the back and the legs is quick and simple. The reason I selected this particular bench is its ability to fold flat for storage. When I'm done using it, I fold it flat and hang it from hooks in the corner of the room. That keeps it out of the way. This is the type of hook I use to hang it:
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Since 1998

customer_reviews.title: Needs better stabilizing
customer_reviews.text: Works for what I need but I foresee stability concerns with dumbbell lifting, especially heavy dumbbell lifting (70lbs and up).
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup and sturdy. I can't speak to how long it will ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick setup and sturdy. I can't speak to how long it will last, but out of the box it 100% a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a reasonably price foldable workout bench for a long time when I came across this one. It was a good price on Amazon and got reviewed pretty nicely. I was not disappointed by the quality. It's petty sturdy and well made. I've had it for probably a couple of years now and haven't had any issues. It's a little bit of a pain to fold up but saves space when you need it to. All in all I'm pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: T. Vukovic

customer_reviews.title: Yahoo
customer_reviews.text: Received this on 10/12/17. Very surprised when I opened the box. The bench was in the storage position and totally assembled. NIce color and finish. All that is needed is for you to decide whether you are going to add the storage pins or install the included bolts if you don’t plan to store it as in the closet, etc. really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for my first bench
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a good bench. It is very sturdy and easy to tuck under a bed. It is however a fairly short bench. I'm 5'10" and I have to sit on the very edge of the seat to lay down flat so my head is supported. I can still use it though, it's just a few inches shorter than I would like. Only enough to knock off one star though. I'd reccomend this bench to anyone my heigh or shorter looking for a good bench to start with. I'm using powerblocks with this bench, a great combination for a apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Webic

customer_reviews.title: Wow, for the price, just wow
customer_reviews.text: Its a bit small for me at 6'4" and honestly just a bit big for my wife at 5'2" but we both can use it just fine, its narrow enough for my wife to use and just wide enough for me. Its a bit short but pretty adjustable, folds flat, I got it to put under the bed, and it would fit just fine, but as small and easily movable as it is I have been able to tuck it in next to the exercise bike and it just moves out of the way nicely. I certainly can't complain it is extremely versatile.
customer_reviews.author: AMZSQ

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took roughly 5 minutes, as it's mostly assembled right out of the box. I use it 3-4x per week and it hasn't let me down. It doesn't incline quite enough for serious crunches and I wish the front leg had a higher adjustment position. (The product picture shows it in it's highest front position) UPDATE: I reversed the stock installation of the front support leg and now it can provide a much steeper incline. Works better now for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Olson

customer_reviews.title: fits my needs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: this is just what i wanted. a portable bench that fits the confines of my apartment. i would like to add, however, if you are expecting to fold this up and slide it under your bed after each workout, you will need a bed that had at least 12" of clearance. that was a bit misleading and the reason i don't give it 5 stars. other than that i have no issues. stable and well constructed. i'm 5'10" & 170 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: where's waldo

customer_reviews.title: Great folding FID bench
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bench for about a month now with my. I am 6'2" with a 34" inseam and it is just barely long enough for me, another half an inch of torso and it might not be. That said, it fits me great and I need it to be as small as possible due to my restricted workout area. When done I fold it up and lean it against a wall. One word about storage, the legs do not lock in the storage position, I ended up using bungee cords to keep it all secure while up against the wall. Over all, quite happy with it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: CallMeChris

customer_reviews.title: and the like. It's not made for lifting super heavy but ...
customer_reviews.text: This bench is exactly what I expected. I live in a 600 square foot apartment so I wanted something I could store out of sight. It is slightly too large to fit under my bed but I can fold it up and store it in the closet, and unfolding takes a minute or less, as do the adjustments. I use it for incline, decline, and flat bench press, at an incline angle for one arm bicep curls, and for dips, stair stepping, and the like. It's not made for lifting super heavy but for maintenance weight training if you're working with very little space like I am this is an excellent practical solution.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I’m really happy with my bench. Very sturdy, doesn’t take up much space and easy to adjust. Just wish it would collapse enough to slide under my bed.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Compact, Well Built, Strong, Good Looking, Good Value Cons: A tad more engineering and it could have laid absolutely flat: this may seem like a minor point, but I would think that the essence of this product is that it is compact. (-.25 Star), the legs should not flail when moving (-.25 Star), a bit narrow (-.5 Star) Overall, happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzed

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Quality Incredible Deal -  Too Good To Be True?  Nope!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I decided to take a chance. This is exactly the kind of quality fitness bench I was looking for. It arrived in 3 days packaged in the Manufacturers Shipping box. Everything was there. It took me 5 minutes to open it and assemble it. It's made out of aircraft grade materials. Very Solid, Very well made. I was so impressed that I went ahead and ordered the Best Fitness Sportsman Home Gym. I expect it to arrive in a few days. If your thinking about getting this, I would give it a solid recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: M. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Could Use an Improvement
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a sturdy, solid bench at a reasonable price which can fold to store in tight spaces. I don't get why the folding legs cannot be pinned into the folded position. You either pin them into the wide open position, which makes it very long for storage, or you fold the legs and you need to be careful when you lift the bench that the legs don't unfold. Very clumsy, and this would be very easy to fix - just add another hole for the pin to lock the legs in storing position.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very well made bench as well as very sturdy for a bench that folds up to next to nothing for storing. I purchased this for my son who needed a bench he could store easily and when we set this one up I was very pleased with how sturdy it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super bench for the price. It has 4 different height adjustable positions and each leg can be either folded or reclined to a different angle to further incline or decline this bench. Also both legs can be folded to make a great floor bench for floor presses as well or to simply be tucked away until your next workout. This is a great product that came already put together right out of the box. If all of best fitness's products are of this quality then they've got a new full time customer.:)
customer_reviews.author: Barrett Withers

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bench
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to go with the "Best Fitness" rack. It goes well with the rack, was easy to assemble and seems sturdy and well built. My only complaint would be the bench has a tiny amount of side to side movement when you get heavier weights. I think this can be corrected by replacing the quick take down pins with actual bolts, which I plan on doing soon.
customer_reviews.author: Skurj

customer_reviews.title: ... of a little over $100 this is a very good bench so far
customer_reviews.text: For the price of a little over $100 this is a very good bench so far. I am 6'6" and 300 lbs. It works great for what I need it for. A portable bench I can put away when I am done with it. Length is more of an issue than the width for me but I make due and don't knock it. If it were to big it wouldn't be very easy to store. Seems sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: ford1911

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench for the price
customer_reviews.text: Looked at a lot of review for a folding bench. Glad I went with this one. It is solid and well constructed. It is easy to adjust. I can see where it would be small if you were really tall. I am 5-6 and it works very well. Glad I went with this one verses the more expensive options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for a building I manage and have ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a building I manage and have gotten a few complaints that it is too thin. Even the smaller residents say that it feels unstable. I would not purchase again and would have returned it had I not gotten rid of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Girlygirl30

customer_reviews.title: Very good bench for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed an inexpensive adjustable bench and this one fits the bill. For the price it's very sturdy, folds away and can be put under my bed for storage and is very stable. The powder coated finish is even and the padding is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Get Real, Butthead

customer_reviews.title: Good bench
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bench for average use. Feels solid, folds up compact and easy to stash away. My one complaint is that they didn't drill holes so you can use the pins to lock the legs in the folded position when you store it. I have to tie mine up with shoe laces to keep it compact when i put it away. Other than that it is convenient and sturdy unit.
customer_reviews.author: Flet

customer_reviews.title: Fitness on the go
customer_reviews.text: Very nice portable fitness bench that is easy to store. I use the bench in my RV. It is easy to handle and to store. Works great with my bowflex dumbbell set.
customer_reviews.author: MEE

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, with storage options, but not under the bed!
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great bench for the value. I use it for a weight training routine and it feels pretty sturdy overall. If you're over 6', it's going to take some careful positioning to get head support at times, but that seems to be the norm. The bench folds up for storage, and it might fit under your bed, but it doesn't fit under mine!
customer_reviews.author: Brad B

customer_reviews.title: Good Bench. Priced Right. Does what it is made for.
customer_reviews.text: Good bench. Well constructed. Holds my weight firmly (258lbs) and whatever I'm lifting, using barbells up to 50lbs. I own a commercial gym and I use this bench in my home. I highly recommend this for serious fitness people. Priced right.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Tobin

customer_reviews.title: Just What I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a collapsible adjustable bench to work out with my bowflex adjustable dumbbells. I knew I needed something sturdy and something that would be easy to store since my condo is small. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to meet those criteria. I am 5'10" 170 and the bench works for me easily, but I would think this bench wouldn't work as well for someone over 6'3". The adjustments are perfect. I use the bench for military press, incline press, regular bench, and decline. My only improvement would to find away to keep the legs from moving when you have it packed away.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench
customer_reviews.text: The bench works great. I bought it as a gift for my 21 year old brother and he loves it. I've done a bit of working out on it with 40 pound free weights and I love how it can be adjusted to different levels to maximize target areas in the workout. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Luckycraftdave

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up and folds away.
customer_reviews.text: This unit works well if you need to store out of the way when you are done using. I store mine in a closet when I'm not using. Very easy to set up and break down. Takes all of 2 minutes. If there is a down side the bench is a little narrow. Assembles super easy in about 1 minute after arrival.
customer_reviews.author: rufit63

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Workout
customer_reviews.text: My dumbbell fitness program centers on a dependable, light, and portable workout bench. The Best Fitness Bench achieves all of those goals. Even though the construction is light, the bench gives you the feel of a heavy commercial stationary bench found in most pro gyms. You have the option to stabilize the legs with standard bolts (included) if you want to be stationary or with fast removable pins (included) to make it portable. I use the fast removable pins so I can quickly throw the bench under my bed when my spouse doesn't want to see it and/or toss it in the back seat of my car when we go to our weekend home. Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This bench is just perfect for us. It is sturdy and you can do flat bench, incline & decline on it. We live in the sticks so our gym has a lot to be desired. The equipment is from the 80's so we have to work out at home. My husband is an ex-body builder, so if he is impressed you know it is good.
customer_reviews.author: PSYuhas

customer_reviews.title: ... a weight bench that you can fold up for easy storage, then this is the bench for you
customer_reviews.text: If you simply need a weight bench that you can fold up for easy storage, then this is the bench for you. I use it with my Body Beast DVD's and it gets the job done. I was trying to use one of those exercise balls but use the bench now - which is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not practical to fold and put away each use.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, bit small and folding is something of a joke. You must pull two pins and the legs still dangle, not really practical to fold up and put away each workout.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench for the money and space!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Bench. Especially the way it allows you to fold it up and store in a small apartment it is necessary. Allows you to turn the living room into a gym and then back into a living room. Versatile!
customer_reviews.author: guardianwill

customer_reviews.title: 190 lbs) but it held my weight plus 2 60 lbs dumbells just fine. Didn't wobble or anything
customer_reviews.text: Used this bench for the first time today. I'm not real big but (5'10", 190 lbs) but it held my weight plus 2 60 lbs dumbells just fine. Didn't wobble or anything. I felt very secure. I like the fact that it folds up and I can put it in my closet instead of having a bench out all the time in my 1 bedroom apt.
customer_reviews.author: MikeHoncho81

customer_reviews.title: Description fits it perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: It is very well made, and folds up easily. I am happy with my purchase. I was pleasantly surprised that I did not have to put it together. The only thing the buyer has to do is decide to use the clamp accessory or bolts to keep it in place. The clamps are for those who would like to collapse it after use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Damiani

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bench for the price, would recommend it to a friend
customer_reviews.author: rupertellis

customer_reviews.title: very nice bench good price
customer_reviews.text: very nice bench fir the money. the width at shoulder level is smaller than at the gym HOWEVER, it is wide enough for men AND women! its sturdy and is darn near ready to go out the box! i would give this 4 3/4 stars... only drawback could be the pad covering...looks and feels nice...just hope it lasts! good buy this bench was tho! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K Irish

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Sturdy and doesn't take up much space. Perfect for small rooms and apartments.
customer_reviews.author: Karma as Karma Does

customer_reviews.title: perfect for dumbbell work
customer_reviews.text: perfect for dumbbell work. pretty compact as well. seems very sturdy. would recommend to anyone needing a space saving bench.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: Solid bench, a little low
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this affordable, sturdy bench. I'm not a big guy, but this feels slightly narrow and it's quite low to the ground compared to other benches. That said, I'm perfectly happy with it, especially given the price.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C. Huertas

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I expected. Light weight, well built. A little narrower and shorter (I'm 5'8") then I'd like, but it is perfect for me needs.
customer_reviews.author: Anne C.

customer_reviews.title: Great bench, amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: This bench is well built and designed, easy to assemble and store, and gives me exactly the support I need for my dumbbell routines. I contacted the manufacturer with an inquiry and was extremely impressed with the speed and helpfulness of their reply. I would certainly buy again from this company.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fetterman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great workout bench. It's foldable, and comes with hooks for resistance band workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Sil Mata

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy bench
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy bench. Exactly what we were looking for. Has extra loops on frame for clipping bands or tubes.,
customer_reviews.author: keeting

customer_reviews.title: Great bench
customer_reviews.text: This bench is very versatile. And it's nice how small you can compact it to for storage, etc. I recommend it. Probably not for the hardcore exercise aficionado, but great for general use by the amateur at home.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with it. Works well and stores out of the way when not in usage. I'm getting great usage out of it. No more going out to exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Chun E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Arrived assembled. Sturdy, solid construction. Will last years.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Snider

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Little Bench in the West
customer_reviews.text: I am A fairly big guy, about 6'1" 185 lbs. and have been working out for the last few years with free weights. My Golds Gym weight bench has served me well however, I needed another bench that would work well for me when I worked out with dumbells. The Best Fittness Bench was a fabulous find for me. I later added the leg extension and preacher curl addition and have developed other exercises using these attachments. I now spend more time with this bench than with my long bar bench. Its is excellent, well made, easy to put together and very sturdy. I would reccomend this product to all.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a very good product for the given price. It's exactly what I wanted. Simple and compact with good build quality. I bought the preacher attachment for it a few weeks after the original purchase.
customer_reviews.author: pouncepounce

customer_reviews.title: Review of Best Fitness Bench BFFID10 FID
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with this bench. I use it primarily for lifting dumbells. I don't have that much room in my apartment so the foldable feature is perfect when it is time to store it away. The set also comes with fixed bolts if you do not need the bench to be folded and stored away after use. 6 Octo arms out of 8! @RacingOctopus
customer_reviews.author: RacingOctopus

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bench, folds up super small for easy storage
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bench, folds up super small for easy storage. would be nice if the legs would lock closed when you move it but still a great buy, super sturdy
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bench, not easy to store.
customer_reviews.text: While this is a great sturdy bench for the money, I bought it mostly because it said it folded flat for easy storage. Unfortunately when folded flat, it's still 12" high and doesn't fit under anything. I am keeping it, but wish it was easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: pameyw

customer_reviews.title: Great bench!
customer_reviews.text: This bench comes fully assembled. All you have to do is unfold it and insert the pins in the legs. We were using it within 5 minutes of opening the box. I saw reviews for other benches that said it took 45 minutes to assemble them - that's crazy! This bench is very sturdy and the ability to fold it up quickly gives us several storage options. Adjustments to the back rest are quick and simple. If you're looking for a great FID bench, quit looking and just buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: B. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Great bench at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I have not been getting to the gymn for a while, mostly scheduling issues, and I decided a little setup in the basement would be the most sustainable plan, but I don't have a lot of room. I wanted a nice, compact, all purpose bench, and after looking at a fair number of these things, this one seemed to fit the bill. It is perfect - just the right size, and flexible. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: MaryBeth Dawson

customer_reviews.title: oksy
customer_reviews.text: well this bench served its purpose. if you are taller than 5'11 it may be too small. small easy to carry around. a little combusome with one part flopping when you flatten it
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Im 5'11 170 lbs and this bench is perfect, easy to adjust and can handle my weight plus the 250 lbs i use for bench press. Its compact so its great for home gyms but does not take up to much room. great product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great construction, but when it folds nothing locks the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great construction, but when it folds nothing locks the legs in place, so they just dangle making it a real pain to move it when it needs to be stored. Horrible engineering on this...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super nice bench!
customer_reviews.text: This bench is great, I use it practically everyday, good quality and doesn't take up alot of room. I really liked that is was completely assembled when it arrived, all I had to do is put the safety pins in.
customer_reviews.author: jmcbeath

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product
customer_reviews.text: Item is flimsy and does not fold flat as advertised made poorly. Tried to returned but was costing me almost as much as to return as I paid for the product so decided to keep.
customer_reviews.author: James Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've own several benches and this is a great bench. Works very well for what I need and came pretty much assembled, just had to tighten a couple of bolts. The bench is very sturdy and feels solid.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and solid
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bench. It is sturdy and heavy and will last a long time. Well Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Its sturdy, well made and it has several uses
customer_reviews.text: For the dollars, you can beat it. Its sturdy, well made and it has several uses. Dont understand the added holes where the locking pins go since only one makes the bench useful. The pros outweigh the cons of this product. But here are the cons: The bench is slippery when doing flat and incline dumbbell presses/flys. The seat part is stationary so you slide off when pushing up heavy ass weight. This is only solved if you put you bench facing a wall and use your feet to counter the sliding against the wall.If I can modify this seat to move, I will. Thats it, not other cons. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: joe callesano

customer_reviews.title: I like that it folds up as I live in an ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that it folds up as I live in an efficiency apartment! It is real solid. Also like that there are several accessory options.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Hanson

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST dumbell bench I have ever found!
customer_reviews.text: this bench is the most compact versatile dumbbell bench you will find. It allows you to do incline as well as decline flyes and presses. I can't think of how you could improve on the price and versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Spence

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces!
customer_reviews.text: My apartment is only 358 square feet, so this foldaway, adjustable bench is perfect for my needs. Also, I'm 6'1" and currently about 250lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Damen J.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy...
customer_reviews.text: This bench is an excellent bargain. It's completely assembled out of the box and although a little narrow it is very sturdy and easy to change the decline, to incline, to flat position easily. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Simple and fast to assemble and start using. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: DrAux

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am about 5' 8 and this bench has done wonders thus far. Just was I was looking for! Yes, the back support of the pad could be just a FEW inches wider for my personal taste..(sometimes its hard to stay centered)...but overall I love it! Doesn't go completely vertical, but I may superglue/bolt something to rig it. Very good price! Shipped fast! (huge box...assembly only a few minutes)
customer_reviews.author: Max F.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good solid bench. Wish it was a bit wider but it does the job well! Very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Lleison Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Versitile Workout Bench !
customer_reviews.text: Can do benches and inclines. Very heavy duty and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Evans

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to change the angle
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy (I am heavyset) and easy to change the angle. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie Bernier

customer_reviews.title: Best Fitness BFFID10 Bench
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy bench. Would buy it again, but we don't have to!
customer_reviews.author: M. Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Too small.
customer_reviews.text: The material quality is good, and the bench is sturdy, but it's too short for me. I'm 6' tall and should not need to have my head hanging off the end. Also the flat position has a slight decline.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made Folding Bench
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy full size bench , well designed, and easy to fold for storage. Strong welded steel loops on the base at the front and rear for resistance bands are spaced perfectly. Good folding bench at great price.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: it is great for what i need
customer_reviews.text: it is great for what i need, its a little heavier then I thought it would be, folds up great, I am pleased with it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: On the small side
customer_reviews.text: This bench is well-made. My problem is that it is shorter than the adjustable benches at the gym. If my head is on the bench, my butt is hanging off. I'm six feet tall. Also, as others have noted, it is very narrow. Good quality construction and very easy to set up. The low price simply reflects fewer materials resulting in smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: James Hemphill

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for me sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wieght bench that is sturdy that i can easily put away after my work outs and this bench is it folds up doesnt take up much space if you want get your bench press on and dont have much alot of space or cant get to the gym i suggest u get this bench
customer_reviews.author: Titus Smith

customer_reviews.title: The Transformer Bench
customer_reviews.text: It took me a couple days to find a bench that could fit my needs and this is definitely it. I had an old bench that I needed to replace due to limited space in my apartment and this bench is perfect. Has decline/incline, it's very sturdy, comfortable padding, and is so compact. Very easy to move from position to position. I even went so far and blogged about it: Fixing A Spatial Dilemma By Malik Abdul Rasheed [...] I'm 5/10 and about 175 pounds. I have no issues with the surface padding area. Get this bench!
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Oxford

customer_reviews.title: Best bench for the price/practicality.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bench for about a month now and couldn't be happier. I'm 5'11'' and don't have a problem using it, although my friend who is 6'2'' feels a little uncomforable when lying flat. I live in a manhattan studio apartment and store the bench between my bed and dressor which is saving me $87 dollars a month on a gym membership. It just makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Shabadue

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Fits in my closet perfectly and it's sturdy. It's somewhat narrow but that allows my shoulders fo have more movement
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little bench! It's pretty much ready to go right out of the box. On top of the 5 or so incline adjustments you can make, you can also adjust the legs (using the safety pins) for further adjustments. It's a little uncomfortable in the decline position (no where to wedge your legs) but other than that, a really nice bench. Feels very sturdy and fairly well padded....goes great with the Best Fitness rack!
customer_reviews.author: Fitness Fan

customer_reviews.title: A great bench for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great workout bench, especially considering its price. It is sturdy, it stays out of the way, and it is versatile. I have made heavy use of it without any wobbling or tipping, and it is comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Monson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully. Easy to adjust and move. Also like the fact you can increase or decrease the height.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This bench is very sturdy and adjustable. If you need something that easily folds up for storage under a bed, in a closet, or in the corner, this is the best bench I could find for the money. I got it shipped for 99.00.
customer_reviews.author: bigfish

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small weight bench as I live in an apt. and the Marcy bench I had was just to large. This bench is perfect for me. Quality material and construction. Allows me to do my rehab workout without taking up a lot of floor space. It handles my 260 lbs with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: Good bench for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The bench works great for working out with dumbbells. It is clumsy and difficult to handle when folded to stash away because the legs don't latch down when tucked away. Overall very good quality bench I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: John Glen Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little bench
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little bench!!! Assembles in 2 minutes. Very sturdy and compact. Legs fully fold below for easy storage. Only caveat: it's not made for a tall person.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK IVAN

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bench is sturdy and exactly what I wanted. My only complaint would be the weight of the bench. I bought this so I could use it a few times a week and store it in my closet the rest of the time. It's pretty easy to fold up but it's a bit cumbersome to carry and it's quite heavy. However, if it wasn't so heavy, it might not be as sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bench. Stable, easily adjustabe, and easy to fold. The anchors for exercise bands could be bigger, but add some carribeners and they are perfect. At the price, this can't be touched.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Cameron

product_meta.title: Best Fitness Flat Incline Decline Bench (BFFID10 )
product_meta.description:
Compact, adjustable, and easy to use, the Best Fitness Flat Incline Decline Bench (BFFID10) is an ideal starting weight bench for home strength-training programs. This incline weight bench has five starting positions that range from a 10-degree negative decline to a 70-degree positive incline, letting you perform a wide variety of barbell and dumbbell exercises from their correct positions. The intuitive design features safety pins and bolts that let you quickly adjust the bench between positions, disassemble it for storage, or keep it set up permanently. The incline exercise bench comes ready to use right out of the box with no assembly required, so you can start working out immediately.

The Best Fitness Flat Incline Decline Bench measures 55 by 18 by 19 inches (L x W x H) when flat and weighs 43 pounds. Expand your workout routine with optional attachments like the Best Fitness Leg Developer and Preacher Curl Attachment (BFPL10) (sold separately). The incline decline weight bench is backed by the Best Fitness Three-Year In-Home Warranty, which covers the frame for three years and all other parts for one year.



AMAZON.COM
Bring everyday strength training into your living room with the Best Fitness BFFID10 bench. Ideal for barbell and dumbbell exercises, the bench is functional, compact, portable, and durable. The bench offers five starting positions--from a 10-degree negative decline to a 70-degree positive incline--along with durable and comfortable 1.75-inch upholstered pads. Once you've chosen the proper position, you can use the bench for dumbbell presses, bicep curls, shoulder presses, ab crunches, and just about any other sitting exercise. No other piece of equipment offers as much exercise versatility as a combination flat, incline, and decline bench. 

 The Best Fitness bench is also cheaper in the long run than joining a health club, which can be an expensive, time-consuming routine. Now you can achieve measurable benefits for your overall health by committing to a regular fitness regimen in the comfort and convenience of your own home. Other details include a durable powder-coated finish, safety pins and bolts for easy adjustments, and compatibility with a preacher curl accessory. Fully assembled right out of the box, the BFFID10 measures 18 by 17 by 54.5 inches (W x H x D) and carries a three-year warranty.
feature_bullets: Combination flat, incline, and decline bench for barbell and dumbbell exercises
5 starting positions, from 10-degree negative decline to 70-degree positive incline
Compact and portable design is ready to use with no assembly required
Safety pins and bolts allow bench to be adjusted easily
Measures 55 by 18 by 19 inches (L x W x H) when flat and weighs 43 pounds
3-year frame warranty with 1-year warranty for all other parts
